{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:56:36.960
    | text      = We're white.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:56:37.960
    | text      = We don't know any better.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:56:38.960
    | text      = The Boxer Rebellion was quelled by an alliance of mainly European powers and the United States.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:56:43.880
    | text      = How dare these people do the thing on their own land?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:56:47.639
    | text      = In 1911, the United States recognized the Republic of China in Chiang Kai-Shek as the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:56:52.119
    | text      = legitimate government in China.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:56:53.679
    | text      = We supplied them with a ton of aid during the Second Sino-Japanese War.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:00.159
    | text      = Oh yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:01.159
    | text      = No, you don't want to be a part of that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:02.159
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:03.159
    | text      = Getting around our isolationist stance by never saying that war was declared.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:07.079
    | text      = Give them aid.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:08.639
    | text      = Do not get in the middle of that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:10.519
    | text      = We begin to like China only in so much as we hated Japan and they were fighting Japan
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:15.840
    | text      = so we softened on them a little bit.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:17.480
    | text      = As World War II broke out, Chiang Kai-Shek was very helpful in making sure that China
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:21.039
    | text      = did not become a member of the Axis Powers.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:23.440
    | text      = After the war, in 1945, civil war broke out in China between the Nationalist Republic
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:27.800
    | text      = of China and the Communist People's Republic of China.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:30.440
    | text      = The United States supported the Nationalists but deemed direct intervention to stop the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:34.719
    | text      = Communists as not being worth the cost it would entail.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:37.920
    | text      = Which is a strange... That whole period of history is fucking... It's fascinating because
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:47.320
    | text      = it's immediately following the end of World War II.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:50.920
    | text      = It's immediately after VE Day and VJ Day.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:56.880
    | text      = Those are the same.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:57.880
    | text      = They're not the same day.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:00.400
    | text      = The point is that the way that we treated Russia and China immediately after the end
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:05.360
    | text      = of World War II has dominated the entirety of our foreign policy with them since then.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:12.079
    | text      = Totally.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:13.079
    | text      = Famously, Eisenhower and Churchill were both like, fucking, let's go to town.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:20.719
    | text      = Let's finish Russia off while we got the chance.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:22.739
    | text      = We need to.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:23.739
    | text      = They're weak right now.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:24.739
    | text      = Let's take them down.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:25.739
    | text      = In the same way, China had just been decimated by the Japanese occupation, which was fucking
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:31.119
    | text      = brutal.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:33.280
    | text      = The extent to which Japanese occupation was brutal is something that is not really quite
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:40.000
    | text      = as discussed in World War II literature as maybe it should be.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:44.639
    | text      = When you think about why we got North Korea and South Korea, then we start talking about
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:48.400
    | text      = the Japanese occupation as well, and the way that we treated the Koreans immediately following
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:52.760
    | text      = World War II, and how we didn't do any goddamn shit there either.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:56.159
    | text      = Then the other question, of course, is what exactly are we supposed to do?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:58:59.119
    | text      = Are we the only people who are supposed to do anything in these times?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:59:03.599
    | text      = Then we abandoned our... There's a whole long mess of things.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:59:07.480
    | text      = It was those small decisions made immediately at the end of World War II that have really
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:59:15.360
    | text      = fucking set the course for both Russian and Chinese relations since then.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:59:22.199
    | text      = That's true, but then you've got to consider that at that point you already had a deep
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:59:25.659
    | text      = history since the literal beginning of our country of being real shitheads to the Chinese.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:59:29.760
    | text      = Well, we've been real shitheads to everybody.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:59:33.760
    | text      = After World War II, like you're saying, we decided it wasn't worth the effort to try
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:59:38.199
    | text      = and help the nationalists fight the communists.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:59:41.820
    | text      = As Secretary of State George Marshall told Congress, the cost of an all-out effort to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:59:45.800
    | text      = see communist forces resisted and destroyed in China would clearly be all out of proportion
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:59:51.159
    | text      = to the result to be obtained.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:59:52.599
    | text      = In essence, we abandoned our ally who helped us avoid further complication in World War
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:59:57.119
    | text      = II and stood back as Mao and the communists took over the country in 1949.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:01.880
    | text      = It would take the U.S. another 30 years to recognize that government, which would be
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:05.579
    | text      = six years after Rockefeller wrote his very short op-ed.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:09.480
    | text      = Between 1949 and 1971, U.S.-China relationships were entirely hostile.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:14.320
    | text      = They sided against us in the Cold War and Mao's Cultural Revolution almost completely
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:18.920
    | text      = isolated China from the rest of the world for many years, even from communist countries
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:23.280
    | text      = such as the Soviet Union.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:25.639
    | text      = Nixon went to China after all... Let's not forget that China was North Korea before North
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:31.039
    | text      = Korea.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:32.039
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:33.039
    | text      = Nixon went to China after what is known as the Ping-Pong diplomacy, U.S. and Chinese
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:35.719
    | text      = Ping-Pong players getting along- Which sounds really racist until you realize
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:39.440
    | text      = they're referring directly to Ping-Pong itself, not-
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:42.519
    | text      = Yeah, a couple of Ping-Pong players got along and we all were like, hey, maybe we can all
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:45.940
    | text      = get along.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:47.199
    | text      = It seems very suspiciously like the Ching-Chong-Bing-Bong alliance, but no, it's a... Yeah, yeah, yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:52.239
    | text      = Yeah, so they ended up... It created an opportunity where an American Ping-Pong player got to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:57.440
    | text      = visit China and it opened up this possibility of other people visiting, who led to the opening
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:05.119
    | text      = of the U.S. liaison office in Beijing and the beginning of normalization of relations.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:10.820
    | text      = At the point that Rockefeller wrote his tiny op-ed article, the world had almost no access
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:15.320
    | text      = to China for decades.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:16.320
    | text      = Some of the assessments that he made as a quote China traveler were probably a little
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:20.400
    | text      = naive or generous, also taking into account that he wanted to try and get into the Chinese
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:24.519
    | text      = market now that it was open.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:27.639
    | text      = Reading that op-ed in that context in my ears, it falls a long way short of open support
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:33.780
    | text      = for Mao and his authoritarian rule.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:35.639
    | text      = A little bit.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:36.639
    | text      = The criticism made of Rockefeller's statement is valid and it's terrible optics to minimize
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:40.119
    | text      = the brutal authoritarianism of Mao.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:42.320
    | text      = That said, there's an argument to be made for the positive statistics during Mao's rule.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:46.980
    | text      = Infant mortality rates dropped from 227 per thousand in 1949 to 53 per thousand in 1983.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:54.280
    | text      = Adult mortality rates increased.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:57.239
    | text      = Not necessarily.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:58.440
    | text      = China had a life expectancy of 35 years in 1949, which went up to 66 years by 1976.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:05.400
    | text      = These stats are not enough to justify his policies, but it would be easy to see those
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:09.480
    | text      = sorts of things as being persuasive signs to someone who came in and just got the lay
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:15.340
    | text      = of the land as a visiting tourist.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:18.559
    | text      = What I'm saying is that David Rockefeller, I think he fucked up in making this op-ed.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:22.280
    | text      = It's a little hasty, possibly, but it's not an all-out sign of globalists being in favor
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:28.039
    | text      = of Mao's authoritarian rule.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:30.320
    | text      = It needs to be taken in the proper context that it existed in, which was decades and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:36.280
    | text      = decades of terrible China relations only being opened up after a very bizarre ping-pong game.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:46.360
    | text      = Terrible relations largely due to our own actions.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:51.920
    | text      = Not like, oh, why is China always being a dick to us?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:54.599
    | text      = Why, they're such assholes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:55.599
    | text      = No, no, no.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:56.599
    | text      = Very much not that case.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:00.599
    | text      = If you went to a conversation with any Chinese person and Nixon at that time, every single
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:10.000
    | text      = grievance the Chinese person would have would be like, yeah, no.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:14.440
    | text      = We totally did that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:15.440
    | text      = Good point.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:16.440
    | text      = For sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:17.440
    | text      = Good point.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:18.440
    | text      = No, absolutely.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:19.440
    | text      = What about that exclusion act?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:20.440
    | text      = Oh, Europe.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:21.440
    | text      = What about those massacres?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:22.440
    | text      = Oh, no, no, no.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:23.440
    | text      = We loved those, but now, now we're against them.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:25.679
    | text      = Yeah, sorry about that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:26.679
    | text      = Yeah, yeah, yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:28.119
    | text      = Whatever the price of the Chinese revolution, it has obviously succeeded not only in producing
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:32.800
    | text      = more efficient and dedicated administration, but also in fostering high morale and community
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:37.739
    | text      = of purpose.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:38.920
    | text      = The social experiment in China under Chairman Mao's leadership is one of the most important
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:43.539
    | text      = and successful in history.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:45.719
    | text      = David Rockefeller, New York Times, August 10th, 1973.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:49.039
    | text      = All right, did he really say that?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:50.920
    | text      = Yeah, that is a real quote from the article, but it's also taken out of context and like
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:54.960
    | text      = then we're one for four, Dan, maybe five.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:00.320
    | text      = At least he said those words.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:01.920
    | text      = Communist China is the model planned society for the new world order.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:07.639
    | text      = China has received more United Nations awards for its policies and form of governance than
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:13.320
    | text      = any other nation.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:14.320
    | text      = I have no idea what that means.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:15.760
    | text      = What wards?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:16.920
    | text      = What awards?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:17.920
    | text      = I have no idea what that means.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:18.920
    | text      = I don't know who's giving who's giving out awards for.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:22.719
    | text      = No idea.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:23.719
    | text      = No, no idea.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:24.719
    | text      = No idea.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:25.719
    | text      = OK.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:26.719
    | text      = In the eyes of globalist planners, authoritarian China is the future authoritarian.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:31.559
    | text      = China adopted the dreaded one child policy from a consortium of eugenics organizations,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:38.000
    | text      = which includes no, no, no red flag thrown up into the air.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:43.960
    | text      = Big red flag.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:44.960
    | text      = Throw it up into the air, Dan.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:46.760
    | text      = So do you want me to go through this about China so you can keep on eating?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:50.320
    | text      = Word for word.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:52.320
    | text      = So China is a country of a very large population, but also one of limited resources in many
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:56.320
    | text      = ways.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:57.320
    | text      = There's a terrible history of famines in the country, history between with eighteen hundred
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:02.079
    | text      = and twenty eight famines recorded between one hundred and eight B.C. in nineteen eleven
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:06.239
    | text      = A.D., including the northern Chinese famine of eighteen seventy six through nineteen eighteen
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:11.599
    | text      = seventy nine, in which nine to thirteen nine to thirteen million people died.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:16.619
    | text      = The great Chinese famine of nineteen fifty eight through nineteen sixty two led to the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:20.440
    | text      = deaths of about fifteen to thirty million people due to starvation.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:25.280
    | text      = Famine in eighteen fifty through eighteen seventy three led to the deaths of over sixty
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:29.659
    | text      = million people.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:31.059
    | text      = One in nineteen forty two to nineteen forty three killed two to three million.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:34.860
    | text      = One from nineteen thirty six to nineteen thirty seven killed approximately five million.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:39.440
    | text      = Famine has historically been a major problem in China because of the weather patterns and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:43.880
    | text      = high incidence of droughts.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:45.760
    | text      = However, all this has naturally been exacerbated at times by the warring states period and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:51.800
    | text      = just general conflict getting in the way of distribution of food or just burning down
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:56.960
    | text      = fields.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
